titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Tannatt Family Currency, Scrip, and Bond Collection 1839-1864
Tannatt Family Currency, Scrip, and Bond Collection

publicationstmt.publisher: Washington State University Libraries Manuscripts, Archives, and Special Collections

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Suzanne James-Bacon. 2016
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid written in English. English.
profiledesc.descrules: Finding aid based on DACS 2nd Edition ( Describing Archives: A Content Standard).

repository.corpname: Washington State University Libraries, Manuscripts, Archives and Special Collections

did.unittitle: Tannatt Family Currency, Scrip, and Bond Collection
did.abstract: The collection consists of paper currency, scrip, and one bond. Most of the items were issued by the Confederate States of America or individual states of the Confederacy. The collection also includes two specimens of scrip (a substitute for currency), one issued by the Ladd and Company plantation on the island of Kauai circa 1839-1844, and the other issued by the United States Army circa 1860s.
did.langmaterial: Collection materials are inEnglish and Hawaiian

scopecontent.p: The collection consists of paper currency, scrip, and one bond. Most of the items were issued by the Confederate States of America or individual states of the Confederacy. The collection also includes two specimens of scrip (a substitute for currency), one issued by the Ladd and Company plantation on the island of Kauai circa 1839-1844, and the other issued by the United States Army circa 1860s.

accessrestrict.p: This collection is open and available for research use.

acqinfo.p: The Tannatt family donated this collection to the Washington State University Libraries at an unknown date. It was originally cataloged as part of VF 2528. It was separated and recataloged in 2010.

relatedmaterial.p: Currency specimens are available in other collections held in MASC, including:
Paul Philemon Kies currency and bond collection, 1769-1865 (Cage 4978)
Confederate States of America currency collection, circa 1860-1866 (Cage 4979)

controlaccess.p: This collection is indexed under the following headings in the online catalog. Researchers desiring materials about related topics, persons, or places should search the catalog using these headings.
